Gortash_Dead_55.speaker: Narrator
Gortash_Dead_55.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Gortash_Dead_56.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_56.text: You seek Gortash? His soul is already suffering at my hands. That is the fate of all those who fail me.

Gortash_Dead_57.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_57.text: If you're not Gortash, then who are you?

Gortash_Dead_32.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_32.text: Let him suffer, then. Isn't that the fate he deserves?

Gortash_Dead_13.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_13.text: Yes. Because it is the fate you've given him.

Gortash_Dead_2.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_2.text: A dead Archduke is of no use to me. A living explorer - a tadpoled fugitive with a knack for survival, perhaps - is a different matter.

Gortash_Dead_7.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_7.text: One question asked. Four still remain.

Gortash_Dead_5.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_5.text: If you're not Gortash, then who are you?

Gortash_Dead_31.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_31.text: I am Bane, The Black Lord. I am the Ultimate Tyrant. I am Fear, I am Hate.

Gortash_Dead_63.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_63.text: And you - you are the dagger that bled Myrkul's favoured. You are the thorns that prick at my sides.

Gortash_Dead_1.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_1.text: Yet you are proof that still I will rise, and Bhaal and Myrkul will yield.

Gortash_Dead_18.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_18.text: You said I am proof you will rise. What did you mean?

Gortash_Dead_60.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_60.text: You live for power. You have proven it with every fallen foe, every chest opened, every skill claimed.

Gortash_Dead_9.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_9.text: As long as mortals and immortals vie for sharper blades and louder voices, I am strengthened.

Gortash_Dead_46.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_46.text: So it is for Bhaal and Myrkul - and so it is for you. You make me eternal.

Gortash_Dead_11.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_11.text: I am no agent of yours. I seek power for proper ends, not for its own sake.

Gortash_Dead_30.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_30.context: NodeContext: Evil chuckle, not too cartoonish.

Gortash_Dead_16.speaker: Narrator
Gortash_Dead_16.text: *The corpse says nothing more. You did not ask a question.*

Gortash_Dead_4.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_4.text: Why did you ally with Myrkul and Bhaal?

Gortash_Dead_53.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_53.text: Why do red dragons ally with the githyanki? Why did the Broken God befriend Tyr?

Gortash_Dead_44.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_44.text: Ah, but you already know the answer. By making one ally, you deny them to another.

Gortash_Dead_6.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_6.text: And by turning mortals illithid, you deny their souls to their keepers.

Gortash_Dead_52.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_52.text: You do not stoke fear by reaping your own fields, but by burning your foe's.

Gortash_Dead_34.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_34.text: What can I do to earn your blessing, Lord Bane?

Gortash_Dead_17.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_17.text: You have already laid the foundation.

Gortash_Dead_48.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_48.text: You gained my favour when you slayed Gortash. Your need for power exceeds even his.

Gortash_Dead_23.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_23.text: Use the Netherstones to commandeer the brain and unleash your infected army, and I will count you among my chosen.

Gortash_Dead_10.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_10.text: Or do not. Your lust for victory still brings you one step closer to me.

Gortash_Dead_58.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_58.text: Where are the Steel Watchers assembled?

Gortash_Dead_54.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_54.text: A chance to speak to the Black Lord, and you ask him directions? How vexingly mundane.

Gortash_Dead_50.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_50.text: You would ask me directions? How vexingly mundane.

Gortash_Dead_28.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_28.text: The Steel Watch Foundry is in the Lower City near the docks. Go, and set eyes on Zariel's gift to my chosen.

Gortash_Dead_39.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_39.text: Not everyone squanders their gifts like you, Karlach.

Gortash_Dead_45.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_45.text: Not everyone squanders their gifts like you, Karlach.

Gortash_Dead_51.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_51.text: How can I reach the Iron Throne?

Gortash_Dead_59.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_59.text: Ah, Gortash's pet project. Iron Throne Headquarters once touched the sky, a monument to martial force.

Gortash_Dead_33.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_33.text: It's been a century since it was submerged in Grey Harbour. You can reach it by a submersible beneath the harbour docks.

Gortash_Dead_14.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_14.text: I look forward to your show of power.

Gortash_Dead_25.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_25.text: Can you help me find the headquarters of Orin the Red?

Gortash_Dead_20.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_20.text: Of course you seek Orin, Bhaal's vengeful chosen. His temple is hidden even to my eyes. How fortuitous, then, that Orin seeks you.

Gortash_Dead_42.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_42.text: Orin is too proud of her own handiwork to linger in your shadow. The vain don't like to be upstaged.

Gortash_Dead_3.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_3.text: She'll make herself known to you - if she hasn't already, in her own special way.

Gortash_Dead_61.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_61.text: It is done. Five questions, and no more.

Gortash_Dead_21.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_21.text: Gortash is dead. But I am undying - just as you've made me.

Gortash_Dead_19.speaker: Player
Gortash_Dead_19.text: You're much more coherent than most corpses. Why's that?

Gortash_Dead_37.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_37.text: So naive for one with such cunning. Do you think it's Gortash speaking to you?

Gortash_Dead_24.speaker: GROUP_GLO_Bane
Gortash_Dead_24.text: I am Bane, the Black Lord. I am the Ultimate Tyrant. I am Fear, I am Hate.

AudienceHallBanite_006_0.speaker: Black Gauntlet Greyward
AudienceHallBanite_006_0.text: Gortash thinks you can be of value. I wouldn't go proving him wrong.

AudienceHallBanite_006_1.speaker: Black Gauntlet Greyward
AudienceHallBanite_006_1.text: No more talk. My jaw needs a rest.

AudienceHallBanite_003_0.speaker: Black Gauntlet Mohlen
AudienceHallBanite_003_0.text: Do not burden me with conversation.

AD_AfterCeremony_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_0.text: We prepare an army of our own. The Steel Watch will be mobilised.

AD_AfterCeremony_8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_8.text: Next, we identify all enemies within our walls and within our ranks.

AD_AfterCeremony_12.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_12.text: They will be imprisoned until they prove... loyal.
AD_AfterCeremony_12.context: NodeContext: sinister, malicious on last word. The implication is 'forced loyalty' by any means

AD_AfterCeremony_2.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_AfterCeremony_2.text: Let the people rejoice: in Archduke Gortash's hands, they are safe.

AD_AfterCeremony_13.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_13.text: A new age is upon us. Gods have mercy on those who would stand in our way.

AD_AfterCeremony_3.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
AD_AfterCeremony_3.text: And if the Steel Watch can't protect us? What then?

AD_AfterCeremony_9.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_AfterCeremony_9.text: The Flaming Fist stand ready. With Gortash at the head, they can't fail.

AD_AfterCeremony_17.speaker: Lady Alia Durinbold
AD_AfterCeremony_17.text: Ravengard - you would give up the Fist's command?

AD_AfterCeremony_15.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_AfterCeremony_15.text: The Watch and the Fist must unite under one authority. Gortash is uniquely qualified for the endeavour.

AD_AfterCeremony_4.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_AfterCeremony_4.text: Under Gortash, the two will conquer the cult army and preserve our city and our heritage.

AD_AfterCeremony_7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_7.text: We restore the Steel Watch to capacity and mobilise it.

AD_AfterCeremony_11.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_11.text: A new age is upon us. Gods have mercy on those who would stand in our way.

AD_AfterCeremony_18.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_AfterCeremony_18.text: Your first act as Archduke, my lord?

AD_AfterCeremony_5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_5.text: We restore the Steel Watch to capacity and mobilise it.

AD_AfterCeremony_1.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_1.text: Next, we identify all enemies within our walls and within our ranks.

AD_AfterCeremony_14.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_14.text: They will be imprisoned until they prove... loyal.
AD_AfterCeremony_14.context: NodeContext: sinister, malicious on last word. The implication is 'forced loyalty' by any means

AD_AfterCeremony_10.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_10.text: We prepare an army of our own. The Steel Watch will be mobilised.

AD_AfterCeremony_20.speaker: Duke Dillard Portyr
AD_AfterCeremony_20.text: Enemies within? Who do you mean?

AD_AfterCeremony_23.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_23.text: Traitors, Portyr. Any who dares speak ill of Baldur's Gate or its people.
AD_AfterCeremony_23.context: NodeContext: Portyr is a noble. Gortash is explaining a truth he feels is self-evident.

AD_AfterCeremony_19.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
AD_AfterCeremony_19.text: Pardon me saying, Archduke, but do the people require such a heavy hand?

AD_AfterCeremony_22.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_22.text: The people demand it. Is a Baldurian truly free when he fears for his future?
AD_AfterCeremony_22.context: NodeContext: usnig the will of the people as justification for his own tyranny. 'Baldurian

AD_AfterCeremony_21.speaker: Duke Dillard Portyr
AD_AfterCeremony_21.text: Enemies within? Who do you mean?

AD_AfterCeremony_24.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_24.text: Traitors, Portyr. Any who dares speak ill of Baldur's Gate or its people.
AD_AfterCeremony_24.context: NodeContext: Portyr is a noble. Gortash is explaining a truth he feels is self-evident.

AD_AfterCeremony_16.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
AD_AfterCeremony_16.text: Pardon me saying, Archduke, but do the people require such a heavy hand?

AD_AfterCeremony_6.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AfterCeremony_6.text: The people demand it. Is a Baldurian truly free when he fears for his future?
AD_AfterCeremony_6.context: NodeContext: usnig the will of the people as justification for his own tyranny. 'Baldurian

AD_BeforeCeremony_2.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BeforeCeremony_2.text: Let us raise our voices. Gather to my shield!
AD_BeforeCeremony_2.context: NodeContext: gettnig a gathering of nobles fired up to raise a toast in his own honour

AD_BeforeCeremony_4.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_4.text: Let us be resolved. Today, we name Lord Enver Gortash as Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

AD_BeforeCeremony_3.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_3.text: The Council is unanimous. Let our walls be girded with steel!

AD_BeforeCeremony_8.speaker: Lady Alia Durinbold
AD_BeforeCeremony_8.text: The Steel Watch is disabled, Gortash. How do you intend to protect this city?

AD_BeforeCeremony_5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BeforeCeremony_5.text: Are you so lacking in imagination, Durinbold?

AD_BeforeCeremony_16.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BeforeCeremony_16.text: A hiccup, nothing more. It is not steel that strengthens us, friends. It is courage.
AD_BeforeCeremony_16.context: NodeContext: inspiring people, exuding his own natural confidence and arrogance

AD_BeforeCeremony_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BeforeCeremony_0.text: Our courage. The Flaming Fist's courage. They have guarded Baldur's Gate for more than a hundred summers and winters.
AD_BeforeCeremony_0.context: NodeContext: inspiring people, exuding his own natural confidence and arrogance

AD_BeforeCeremony_14.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_14.text: I stand with Gortash. I would trust no other.

AD_BeforeCeremony_6.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_6.text: An army of evil, an all-conquering force. We must not stand idle as it burns the city to ash!

AD_BeforeCeremony_7.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_7.text: Portyr. I will not mire us in endless red tape. Baldur's Gate deserves a true leader, not a council of simpering bureaucrats.

AD_BeforeCeremony_18.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BeforeCeremony_18.text: Ulder, my friend. You humble me. But the will of the people...
AD_BeforeCeremony_18.context: NodeContext: about to be named Archduke - he is not humbled in the slightest, and is in fact absolutely full of himself. 'Ulder' is another Duke he's in conversation with.

AD_BeforeCeremony_19.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_19.text: The people chant your name in the streets and taverns, Gortash. In your Steel Watch, they find refuge.

AD_BeforeCeremony_17.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
AD_BeforeCeremony_17.text: You mean no less to them than their salvation.

AfterCeremony_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AfterCeremony_0.text: You will see sense. And you will return to me when you do.

AfterCeremony_3.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AfterCeremony_3.text: Bring Orin's Netherstone with you. Come without it, and my Lord's wrath will be loosed.

AfterCeremony_1.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AfterCeremony_1.text: Bring me Orin's Netherstone. I'll be waiting upstairs.

AfterCeremony_4.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AfterCeremony_4.text: Kill Orin and take her Netherstone. Find me in my office upstairs when it's done.

AfterCeremony_2.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AfterCeremony_2.text: And do not return until it is done. Let this be my one warning.

AudienceHallBanite_004_0.speaker: Black Gauntlet Aischa
AudienceHallBanite_004_0.text: In this sanctum, you will obey our lord and Archduke.

AudienceHallBanite_004_1.speaker: Black Gauntlet Aischa
AudienceHallBanite_004_1.text: The word of our lord is sacred. You will not defy it.

Patriar_010_0.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
Patriar_010_0.text: Stone and steel. That is our way.

Patriar_010_1.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
Patriar_010_1.text: The city is only as strong as its walls. Gortash understands this.

Patriar_008_1.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
Patriar_008_1.text: Finally, a leader worthy of this city.

Patriar_008_2.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
Patriar_008_2.text: Baldur's Gate was due for a shake-up.

Patriar_009_0.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
Patriar_009_0.text: Nothing can touch us, not behind these walls.

Patriar_009_1.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
Patriar_009_1.text: Thank the living gods Gortash is here to protect us.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_2.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_2.text: Will you take up arms if the walls are breached?

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_1.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_1.text: Of course. It is the duty of a patriar to defend the citizens of Baldur's Gate with his life if need be.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_0.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_0.text: Although it's been some years since I last donned my armour. It may need some minor adjustments around the waist.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_5.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_5.text: Gortash made out the Steel Watch were invincible - the pinnacle of Baldurian genius and enterprise.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_4.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_4.text: I'm sure they'll be operational again soon enough.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_11.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_11.text: I wish I had your confidence.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_6.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_6.text: My cousin tells me the Lords of Waterdeep have requested a shipment of Steel Watchers to help defend against the Absolute.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_9.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_9.text: I trust the request was denied? We need to look to our own defences until the danger has passed.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_8.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_8.text: I trust Lord Gortash to protect the city, but unless he can secure the trade routes, the Absolute's armies can suffocate us.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_7.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_7.text: As long as we're not overrun with refugees, there are supplies enough to survive a long siege. It's only your purse that will suffer.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_10.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_10.text: My purse is my most sensitive organ.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_12.speaker: Lord Raylen Jannath
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_12.text: Once he's dealt with the cult, Gortash should turn the Steel Watch on the Guild.

AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_3.speaker: Lord Myer Ravenshade
AD_PatriarsDiscussBusiness_3.text: That would be rash. The Guild are part of the fabric of the city - in their way, they keep order as well as the Fist do.

Patriar_007_2.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
Patriar_007_2.text: Ravengard, freed from the Hells. Archduke Gortash secures our borders. Baldur's Gate's future is bright indeed.

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_002_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_002_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_004_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_004_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

AD_RavengardDies_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_RavengardDies_Combat_0.text: The hero Ravengard's fallen. Be forever known as his killer!

AD_Attack_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_Attack_0.text: The Absolute's agents are among us. Show no mercy!

AD_TakingTurn_004_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_004_Combat_0.text: From your ashes, Baldur's Gate will be reborn!
AD_TakingTurn_004_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: in combat,feigning total confidence, but with a hint of desperation

AudienceHallBanite_005_0.speaker: Black Gauntlet Ignur
AudienceHallBanite_005_0.text: You will hear, and you will heed.

AudienceHallBanite_005_1.speaker: Black Gauntlet Ignur
AudienceHallBanite_005_1.text: Comply, and you have nothing to fear.

AD_TakingTurn_005_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_005_Combat_0.text: Fetid rat. You will not take this city.
AD_TakingTurn_005_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, determined and angry

Patriar_005_0.speaker: Lady Ruth Linnacker
Patriar_005_0.text: Under the Archduke, we are untouchable.

Patriar_005_1.speaker: Lady Ruth Linnacker
Patriar_005_1.text: Archduke Gortash, man of the people. The right people.

AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_002_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, angry that his claim on the city is being challenged

NetherbrainMindmeld_18.speaker: Narrator
NetherbrainMindmeld_18.text: *Howling, like a great wind through a canyon. It engulfs your mind, drowns your senses.*
NetherbrainMindmeld_18.context: CinematicNodeContext: A howl fills the player's ears, and they grasp their heads in agony. This is more than a mind meld. This is an assault from the elder brain.

NetherbrainMindmeld_20.speaker: Narrator
NetherbrainMindmeld_20.text: *Above the howl rises a screech, gleeful and maniacal. It is the way and the truth. Absolute.*
NetherbrainMindmeld_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: The elder brain screeches in glee over the howl in the player's ears.

NetherbrainMindmeld_13.speaker: Narrator
NetherbrainMindmeld_13.text: *The screech quiets, the howl fades. Your mind is hollow, save one lone voice.*
NetherbrainMindmeld_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The howl and screech fade, and the player returns to normal.

NetherbrainMindmeld_7.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_7.text: Bane's Chosen has fallen - his Netherstone is yours. You have done well.

NetherbrainMindmeld_11.speaker: Player
NetherbrainMindmeld_11.text: Where do we go from here?

NetherbrainMindmeld_3.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_3.text: The elder brain is regaining its autonomy.

NetherbrainMindmeld_8.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_8.text: It cries not from pain but exultation.

NetherbrainMindmeld_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_0.text: We must stop it, before it breaks free.

NetherbrainMindmeld_4.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_4.text: One Netherstone remains - Orin's. We must find her and take it from her.

NetherbrainMindmeld_14.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_14.text: After that, we take control of the brain. You should start wondering what you will do then.

NetherbrainMindmeld_16.speaker: Player
NetherbrainMindmeld_16.text: I will put an end to it.

NetherbrainMindmeld_15.speaker: Player
NetherbrainMindmeld_15.text: I'll decide that when we get there.

NetherbrainMindmeld_6.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
NetherbrainMindmeld_6.text: Sometimes you surprise me with your wisdom.

NetherbrainMindmeld_5.speaker: Player
NetherbrainMindmeld_5.text: I will become the Absolute myself.

GortashInOffice_8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_8.text: I once saw value in our alliance. But you have proven most disloyal.

GortashInOffice_85.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_85.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.

GortashInOffice_139.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_139.text: Your actions sparked the fall of my Steel Watch. Whatever bargain we might have made fell with it.
GortashInOffice_139.context: NodeContext: barely containing his anger - he's been betrayed, and is furious

GortashInOffice_32.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_32.text: We will meet under the city and take control of the brain. Then we will take our rightful place as its rulers.

GortashInOffice_46.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_46.text: We could have been allies. Powerful ones. And yet -

GortashInOffice_59.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_59.text: You have the Netherstones - they resonate with my own.

GortashInOffice_4.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_4.text: I commend you for putting an end to Orin's madness - she must be screaming bloody murder in the Hells even now.
GortashInOffice_4.context: NodeContext: extremely pleased - Orin is a recently-slain enemy of his

GortashInOffice_76.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_76.text: How was the reunion? I trust you demonstrated your particular spark of creative genius?
GortashInOffice_76.context: NodeContext: referring to the player's sadistic streak - pleased they may have demonstrated it on somebody he hated

GortashInOffice_160.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_160.text: I always preferred your methods to hers. You have mastery over your Urges, Orin was consumed by her gruesome obsessions.
GortashInOffice_160.context: NodeContext: assuring that this is true - heavy emphasis on 'alawys'

GortashInOffice_137.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_137.text: That's why I killed Orin, as promised in the terms of our pact.

GortashInOffice_116.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_116.text: You talk like you're better than us, but you're a killer too.

GortashInOffice_63.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_63.text: I see murder as a grim necessity, to provoke a desired response from those who witness it. To Orin, it was a pleasurable pastime.
GortashInOffice_63.context: NodeContext: correcting a misconception about himself - he's no murderer, he's a politician

GortashInOffice_119.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_119.text: I don't even want to know what it is to you.
GortashInOffice_119.context: NodeContext: speaking about murder, to a mass murderer. hint of disgust

GortashInOffice_53.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_53.text: The Chionthar will run red. It is time.

GortashInOffice_154.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_154.text: Then you know what must be done.

GortashInOffice_120.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_120.text: This world can be ours, Gortash. We have Bhaal's blessing.

GortashInOffice_79.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_79.text: You're wrong, my Urges are only ever a step away from controlling me.

GortashInOffice_50.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_50.text: Bhaal allows you to pick your battles, as long as you do pick them. Orin thinks she needs to slash every throat in sight.
GortashInOffice_50.context: NodeContext: confident. 'bhaal' is the god of murder - he's speaking to an offspring of that god, and convincing them they are no tmonsters

GortashInOffice_15.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_15.text: My Urges are gone from me, as is any trace of Bhaal.

GortashInOffice_2.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_2.text: I'm surprised Bhaal allowed you to slip away from his grasp. But this changes nothing.
GortashInOffice_2.context: NodeContext: slight surprise, but no concern

GortashInOffice_122.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_122.text: With me, you will have power greater than Bhaal could have given you, and you will bow to no master.

GortashInOffice_52.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_52.text: Atonement is what I seek now.

GortashInOffice_69.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_69.text: Whatever happened in that Temple, it doesn't change what you're guilty of, and the rewards your guilt will sow.
GortashInOffice_69.context: NodeContext: trying to get his conversation partner enthused when they seem downbeat

GortashInOffice_138.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_138.text: And you brought Karlach to heel. See that she remains obedient - my offer is not for her, it is for you.

GortashInOffice_88.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_88.text: But you have a chaotic streak of your own. You broke into my prison to rescue Karlach.
GortashInOffice_88.context: NodeContext: weighing up the person you're speaking to, and laying out their flaws

GortashInOffice_104.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_104.text: That angered me, I will not deny it. But it also showed courage - and I respect courage. We can work together, provided we build a foundation of trust -
GortashInOffice_104.context: NodeContext: rational, in control - interrupted by an earthquake on the last word

GortashInOffice_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: The room shakes from a "brainquake".

GortashInOffice_133.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_133.text: The brain awakens - we must act now. Faithful, come forward.

GortashInOffice_20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Several Banites step from the corner shadows, one at a time. They look fierce and dangerous.

GortashInOffice_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Finally, the Steel Watcher stepw forward. It activates, looking devastatingly powerful.

GortashInOffice_170.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_170.text: Hand me the Netherstones, and we will rule as one.

GortashInOffice_44.speaker: Lae'zel
GortashInOffice_44.text: Kill him and take his stone. The Grand Design cannot come to pass.

GortashInOffice_136.speaker: Shadowheart
GortashInOffice_136.text: Good idea. And let's trust the fox to safeguard the chicken coop, while we're at it.

GortashInOffice_152.speaker: Astarion
GortashInOffice_152.text: Call me cynical, but I'm not sure we can trust the god of tyranny's Chosen to happily share power.

GortashInOffice_47.speaker: Wyll
GortashInOffice_47.text: Do what he asks. My father's life is in his hands.

GortashInOffice_147.speaker: Gale
GortashInOffice_147.text: Hmm. I can think of more trustworthy accomplices - more than a few, in fact.

GortashInOffice_40.speaker: Karlach
GortashInOffice_40.text: If there was ever a moment to kill this fucker, this is it.

GortashInOffice_168.speaker: Halsin
GortashInOffice_168.text: We would struggle to find a less trustworthy creature.

GortashInOffice_1.speaker: Jaheira
GortashInOffice_1.text: That is the royal 'we', I think. Little men do not like to share power.

GortashInOffice_70.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_70.text: Take the Netherstones. We will control the brain and reform the Sword Coast in our image.

GortashInOffice_159.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_159.text: If we are to rule together, the stones should be split between us. I keep mine, you keep yours.

GortashInOffice_56.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_56.text: I'm not here for games. Hand me the stones, or face the black hand of Lord Bane.

GortashInOffice_77.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_77.text: All right. No need for violence. Take the Netherstones.

GortashInOffice_143.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_143.text: You surrender your advantage too quickly. I did not expect such craven behaviour from one who faced Orin and lived.

GortashInOffice_117.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_117.text: Such a weak ally is of no use to me. I will have to repurpose you.

GortashInOffice_31.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_31.text: I think I will hang your corpse in the Wide - the Archduke's would-be assassin. The people will celebrate your fall, and my part in it.

GortashInOffice_35.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_35.text: Your bones will be a souvenir of what could've been.

GortashInOffice_134.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_134.text: Now, roll over and die - give up your life just as easily as you were ready to give up the stones.

GortashInOffice_67.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_67.text: We can be allies but Ketheric and Orin's stones stay with me.

GortashInOffice_113.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_113.text: As they should. I was merely testing you. This should be an alliance of peers.
GortashInOffice_113.context: NodeContext: Very pleased with himself, and with the player.

GortashInOffice_141.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_141.text: You've got a backbone, and the makings of a leader. The Dark Lord Bane blesses our alliance.

GortashInOffice_81.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_81.text: Our time is short. The elder brain is held beneath the city. We must go to it if we're to control it.

GortashInOffice_131.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_131.text: There is a vessel to the Morphic Pool, where the brain feeds. I will wait for you at the pool.

GortashInOffice_48.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_48.text: With the Netherstones in hand, the brain can't resist us. We will be Absolute, with an infected army at our beck and call.

GortashInOffice_18.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_18.text: First, we take Baldur's Gate, then Faerûn. All of Toril will soon follow. A thousand kingdoms, at our command.

GortashInOffice_82.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_82.text: Study Gortash. What are his intentions?

GortashInOffice_14.speaker: Narrator
GortashInOffice_14.text: *Half a smile shows he is teasing you. He doesn't think for one moment you'd fully submit to him, nor should a Spawn as formidable as you.*

GortashInOffice_58.speaker: Narrator
GortashInOffice_58.text: *You spot the hint of a smile. He is testing you - he wants you to refuse.*

GortashInOffice_92.speaker: Narrator
GortashInOffice_92.text: *There is no telling what schemes Gortash could be planning.*

GortashInOffice_24.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_24.text: Study Gortash again. What more can you glean?

GortashInOffice_49.speaker: Narrator
GortashInOffice_49.text: *Gortash studies you carefully in turn. He is shrewd and headstrong, and he expects the same of you.*

GortashInOffice_23.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_23.text: I will not tolerate weakness. A strong ally requires strong will.

GortashInOffice_73.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_73.text: One final test. Will they defy me and prove their worth, or will they cower?

GortashInOffice_83.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_83.text: Study Gortash. What are his intentions?

GortashInOffice_9.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_9.text: I will kill you and take your stone for myself.

GortashInOffice_36.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_36.text: And here I thought you could resist your Urge. I hate being wrong. I guess I'll have to make use of you in a different manner.

GortashInOffice_66.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_66.text: You choose death? What a terrible pity.

GortashInOffice_165.speaker: Minsc
GortashInOffice_165.text: The only thing I will hand you is my fist, tyrant. And there will be a sword in it.
GortashInOffice_165.context: NodeContext: First line delivered as if it's a snappy comeback. Second line is a necessary amendment in case his meaning wasn' t clear

GortashInOffice_19.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
GortashInOffice_19.text: If he holds all the stones, he holds all the power. We must keep our portion if this alliance is to endure.

GortashInOffice_142.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_142.text: The brain awakens - we must act now.

GortashInOffice_130.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_130.text: My involvement with Orin was never a true alliance. A mad dog understands the yank of the leash and the hand of its master, but it cannot be an equal.
GortashInOffice_130.context: NodeContext: dismissive of Orin, glad she's now dead

GortashInOffice_145.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_145.context: NodeContext: heavy emphasis on 'you' - 'you' to the exclusion of all others

GortashInOffice_128.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_128.text: We will raise a Black Keep in Baldur's Gate. Then we will conquer the Sword Coast, and unite all its peoples under our rule. But first -
GortashInOffice_128.context: NodeContext: Triumphant. Interrupted by an earthquake on the last word

GortashInOffice_80.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_80.text: So much might, so much power. Together, we might have been great. We could have shaped the Coast in our image.
GortashInOffice_80.context: NodeContext: exasperated that a potential alliance has fallen through

GortashInOffice_62.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_62.text: But you failed to retrieve Orin's Netherstone. What a waste.

GortashInOffice_42.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_42.text: But you failed to deliver Ketheric's Netherstone. What a waste.

GortashInOffice_21.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_21.text: But you had to make a mess of things. What a waste.

GortashInOffice_161.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_161.text: Don't be rash. We might benefit from an alliance.

GortashInOffice_127.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_127.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_71.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_71.text: I did what I had to. I have no regrets.

GortashInOffice_157.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_157.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_72.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_72.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

GortashInOffice_94.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_94.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I -
GortashInOffice_94.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_101.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_101.text: I'm not done making messes, Gortash. Your blood on this floor, for instance.

GortashInOffice_60.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_60.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_135.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_135.text: I warned you. You could have walked away.

GortashInOffice_110.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_110.text: But your actions sparked the fall of my Iron Throne. Whatever alliance we might have made fell with it.
GortashInOffice_110.context: NodeContext: barely containing his anger - he's been betrayed, and is furious

GortashInOffice_158.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_158.text: Don't be rash. We could be good for each other.

GortashInOffice_112.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_112.text: Good for each other? Don't be -
GortashInOffice_112.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_29.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_29.text: For what it's worth, I think I always liked you, too. But this is how it must be.

GortashInOffice_125.speaker: Narrator
GortashInOffice_125.text: *There is hesitation in his eye for one moment. A passing thought of all times spent together you'll never remember.*

GortashInOffice_55.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_55.text: I did what I had to. I have no regrets.

GortashInOffice_107.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_107.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_97.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_97.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

GortashInOffice_22.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_22.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I -
GortashInOffice_22.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_25.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_25.text: An alliance? All I want is your head.

GortashInOffice_103.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_103.context: NodeContext: Cut off as an earthquake starts to rattle the room

GortashInOffice_140.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_140.text: A partial resonance. You carry Thorm's Netherstone.

GortashInOffice_33.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_33.text: Yet you've returned without Orin's. This was not the agreement.

GortashInOffice_121.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_121.text: Give me more time. I'll come back when I have Orin's stone.

GortashInOffice_28.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_28.text: I gave you time - and you used it to snub my word and bring my Iron Throne to ruin.
GortashInOffice_28.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

GortashInOffice_26.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_26.text: I gave you time - and you used it to sow chaos at my Iron Throne.
GortashInOffice_26.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

GortashInOffice_78.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_78.text: I gave you time, but you used it to strike at my Steel Watch.
GortashInOffice_78.context: NodeContext: angry, the person he's speaking to just asked for more time and he's already given them enough

GortashInOffice_111.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_111.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear parents.

GortashInOffice_149.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_149.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear father.

GortashInOffice_108.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_108.text: I gave you time, but you used it to kill my dear mother.

GortashInOffice_129.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_129.text: I gave you time - and yet here you stand, with only whinging to show for it.

GortashInOffice_99.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_99.text: I didn't believe you. That you have always wanted me to rule by your side.

GortashInOffice_74.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_74.text: Forget your bargain. You had no intention of honouring it.

GortashInOffice_5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_5.text: I am a man of my word. I had every intention.
GortashInOffice_5.context: NodeContext: Angry - he's speaking the truth and has been betrayed

GortashInOffice_10.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_10.text: Yet you snubbed my warning and brought my Iron Throne to ruin.

GortashInOffice_57.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_57.text: The brain awakens. It's time I take matters into my own hands.

GortashInOffice_163.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_163.text: We could have moved mountains, we could have shaken the planes. And you chose imperfection.

GortashInOffice_43.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_43.text: Yet you sowed chaos at my Iron Throne. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.

GortashInOffice_84.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_84.text: Yet you struck my Steel Watch. You blatantly mocked the terms of my bargain.

GortashInOffice_118.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_118.text: Yet Orin still lives, still holds her stone. You blatantly mock the terms of my bargain.
GortashInOffice_118.context: NodeContext: Angry - note, 'mock' is present tense on purpose

GortashInOffice_115.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_115.text: Our dedication to Bane binds us. You would turn on our Lord's faithful?

GortashInOffice_37.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_37.text: You betrayed our Lord by ignoring his Chosen. I speak; you obey.

GortashInOffice_54.speaker: Player
GortashInOffice_54.text: I'm done playing these games, Gortash. This ends now.

GortashInOffice_39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_39.text: This was no game. My word was my bond.
GortashInOffice_39.context: NodeContext: Angry - he's speaking the truth and has been betrayed

GortashInOffice_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his arm, showing his gauntlet. The Netherstone in it does not gleam, but remains as it is. He lowers his arms.

GortashInOffice_27.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
GortashInOffice_27.text: Not a single flash of resonance. Not only do you not carry Thorm's Netherstone - you don't carry Orin's.

Ravengard_1.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_1.text: Be in awe, Truest Soul. The new dawn will rise.

Ravengard_41.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_41.text: *Your father, once the Grand Duke, now a pawn in the Absolute's game. Your infected minds smoulder in each others' presence.*

Ravengard_44.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_44.text: My dearest boy. The Hells have touched you. But you've come to me - just as Gortash said you would.

Ravengard_28.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_28.text: Father and son, unstoppable generals. Together, we will usher in a new dawn.

Ravengard_59.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_59.text: My dearest boy, my blood and my pride. You've come to me - just as Gortash said you would.

Ravengard_58.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_58.text: A fresh mind, still untouched. You have not yet heard the Absolute's voice.

Ravengard_35.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_35.text: So much to teach, and so much to learn.

Ravengard_75.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_75.text: Truest of Souls. Bathed in Her light.

Ravengard_108.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_108.text: *There is a fleeting connection. Your parasite communes with his, then falls quiet.*
Ravengard_108.context: CinematicNodeContext: Slight mind meld just through the course of the node.

Ravengard_8.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_8.text: My dearest boy. The Hells have touched you. But you've come to me - just as Gortash said you would. A True Soul no less.

Ravengard_29.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_29.text: Father and son, unstoppable generals. You and your allies will usher in a new dawn.

Ravengard_11.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_11.text: Have you come to behold the new dawn?

Ravengard_48.speaker: Player
Ravengard_48.text: I'm here to help you. Florrick sent me.

Ravengard_38.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_38.text: Help me? Ah - the black widow caught you in her web.

Ravengard_0.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_0.text: Florrick chose shadow over light. Her betrayal burned deeper than the fires of Avernus.

Ravengard_68.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_68.text: She's been punished for her lies. Don't let her get to you.

Ravengard_16.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_16.text: *The Duke wants to keep Florrick's location a secret. Little does he know that you've already found and freed her.*

Ravengard_87.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_87.text: *The Duke wants to keep Florrick's location a secret. Little does he know that you've already found her.*

Ravengard_45.speaker: Lae'zel
Ravengard_45.text: Punished? Then Florrick's been captured. Or worse.
Ravengard_45.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_93.speaker: Shadowheart
Ravengard_93.text: Punished? Florrick must be locked up somewhere - assuming she's still alive.
Ravengard_93.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_113.speaker: Astarion
Ravengard_113.text: When he says 'punished' do you think he means 'locked up' or 'brutally murdered'?
Ravengard_113.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_102.speaker: Gale
Ravengard_102.text: Why do I get the feeling the punishment will be far, far worse than the crime?
Ravengard_102.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_33.speaker: Karlach
Ravengard_33.text: Punished?! Gods. Don't want to imagine what that entails. Maybe there's still time to find her.
Ravengard_33.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_116.speaker: Halsin
Ravengard_116.text: Punished? Then Florrick has been captured... or perhaps is no more.
Ravengard_116.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_3.speaker: Jaheira
Ravengard_3.context: NodeContext: Spoken as an aside to player - soft but sharp, suddenly tense. You want to know what became of an ally.

Ravengard_13.speaker: Player
Ravengard_13.text: Connect with Ravengard's parasite to seek information about Florrick.

Ravengard_63.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_63.text: *Within Ravengard's memories, you find Counsellor Florrick. She is confined in a cell, right here in Wyrm's Rock.*

Ravengard_14.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_14.text: *You are unable to penetrate Ravengard's mind.*

Ravengard_18.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_18.text: The sun rises, True Soul. Are you ready?

Ravengard_92.speaker: Player
Ravengard_92.text: What have you done to Florrick?

Ravengard_10.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_10.text: I've stilled her tongue. That's the end of the matter.

Ravengard_115.speaker: Minsc
Ravengard_115.text: 'Punished'...? That is meaning more than a spanking, in a place such as this.
Ravengard_115.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_5.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Ravengard_5.text: How do Baldurans punish traitors? Hanging? Dismemberment? I hope we get to see.
Ravengard_5.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_83.speaker: Wyll
Ravengard_83.text: Punished? Gods - what has he done?
Ravengard_83.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_42.speaker: Player
Ravengard_42.text: The Absolute's time has come. She will bring glory to the city.

Ravengard_23.speaker: Player
Ravengard_23.text: Indeed. The Absolute will bring glory upon this fair city.

Ravengard_67.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_67.text: Faerûn suffers in darkness. Tyr has abandoned us; Helm's eye has strayed.

Ravengard_61.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_61.text: *Tyr's fury glows within you. Despite Ravengard's words, the Lord of Justice has remained loyal to you, as you have to him.*

Ravengard_56.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_56.text: But Baldur's Gate will soon burn bright. A beacon to light the heavens.

Ravengard_72.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_72.text: Gortash and I will ignite the final spark. And that, True Soul, is the greatest of goods.

Ravengard_51.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_51.text: And it will be Gortash who ignites the final spark.

Ravengard_84.speaker: Wyll
Ravengard_84.text: No - this isn't him. This is the tadpole talking.
Ravengard_84.context: NodeContext: Upset at seeing his father being controlled by the Absolute

Ravengard_36.speaker: Player
Ravengard_36.text: 'New dawn'? Is that what you call the tyranny the Absolute brings to Baldur's Gate?

Ravengard_95.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_95.text: Why do you say this? Only the shadows would name the sun a tyrant.

Ravengard_66.speaker: Player
Ravengard_66.text: Gortash is a tyrant. This 'new dawn' is a lie.

Ravengard_98.speaker: Player
Ravengard_98.text: By the gods, what have they made of the city's great hero?

Ravengard_88.speaker: Player
Ravengard_88.text: My father, my hero. I'll save you from the Absolute's thrall.

Ravengard_85.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_85.text: What is a hero, if not an actor for the greater good?

Ravengard_26.speaker: Player
Ravengard_26.text: Don't you understand? You are infected with an illithid parasite.

Ravengard_9.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_9.text: *For a brief moment, uncertainty clouds his mind, then dissipates. The Astral Prism vibrates in concord.*
Ravengard_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard touches his head for a brief moment. He is taken aback for a moment.

Ravengard_52.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_52.text: *Behind Ravengard's eyes, something stirs. A spark of life, of self.*

Ravengard_123.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_123.context: NodeContext: The real Ravengard breaks through his brainwashing, just for a moment.

Ravengard_96.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_96.text: *Ravengard's eyes grow empty again. Once again, he speaks coolly and calmly.*

Ravengard_15.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_15.text: *Your tadpole seizes, the Prism stills. Ravengard's empty eyes meet yours.*
Ravengard_15.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard shakes his head, regaining control.

Ravengard_2.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_2.text: As I said. Baldur's Gate will ascend. Toril's first and only Grand City.

Ravengard_109.speaker: Wyll
Ravengard_109.text: Father, please. Come back to me.

Ravengard_126.speaker: Player
Ravengard_126.text: Call on your tadpole. Explore Ravengard's uncertainty.

Ravengard_37.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_37.text: *First comes a vision of terror. The city of Baldur's Gate taken by illithids.*

Ravengard_127.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_127.text: *But beyond terror, there is hope. You see a beaming Ravengard presiding over the sunlit city, applauded by the people - a people at peace.*

Ravengard_78.speaker: Lae'zel
Ravengard_78.text: The real Ravengard's still in there - and he wants out.
Ravengard_78.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_105.speaker: Shadowheart
Ravengard_105.text: The true Ravengard is still clinging on, somewhere in that mind. It might not be too late for him.
Ravengard_105.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_107.speaker: Astarion
Ravengard_107.text: So, the real man is still in there somewhere.
Ravengard_107.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_106.speaker: Gale
Ravengard_106.text: Ravengard hasn't given up yet. His true self is still in there, and could yet be saved.
Ravengard_106.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_55.speaker: Karlach
Ravengard_55.text: Ravengard - the real Ravengard - is in there somewhere. We can't give up on him.
Ravengard_55.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_119.speaker: Halsin
Ravengard_119.text: The true Ravengard remains in there somewhere. Perhaps he can yet be restored.
Ravengard_119.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_12.speaker: Jaheira
Ravengard_12.text: The illithids have not erased him entire. Perhaps there is hope yet.
Ravengard_12.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_114.speaker: Minsc
Ravengard_114.text: The true Ravengard still lives within. If Minsc could be freed from his fleshy prison, then so can the Duke!
Ravengard_114.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_20.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Ravengard_20.text: Ravengard is still alive, trapped in his own mind. Just as I was.
Ravengard_20.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player., with sympathy for Ravengard. She wouldn't wish this on her worst enemy

Ravengard_111.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_111.text: *The true Ravengard lurks somewhere in this infected mind, seeking freedom - seeking victory.*
Ravengard_111.context: NodeContext: Spoken softly as an aside to player.

Ravengard_80.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_80.text: *The Prism quivers once more. Ravengard falters.*
Ravengard_80.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard shakes his head, trying to rid it of his inner turmoil.

Ravengard_49.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_49.text: My dearest boy, my blood and my pride. You've come to me - just as Gortash said you would. A True Soul no less.

Ravengard_97.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_97.text: Her sun will rise. Our future is decided.

Ravengard_103.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_103.text: Be in awe, Truest Soul. The new dawn will rise.

Ravengard_117.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_117.text: Our time has come, son. Together, we will usher in a new dawn.

Portyr_1.speaker: Duke Dillard Portyr
Portyr_1.text: What glory, our city. And what glory, its future.

AudienceHallBanite_002_0.speaker: Iron Consul Mian
AudienceHallBanite_002_0.text: Respect Lord Gortash, and he will respect you in kind.

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_001_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_001_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

AudienceHallBanite_001_0.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_0.text: You seek Archduke Gortash, do you not? Take the door to the right of the throne, just through the grating.

AudienceHallBanite_001_7.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_7.text: But know this: If you do not possess the stone he requires, he will cleave you straight through.

AudienceHallBanite_001_5.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_5.text: I trust nothing more needs to be said on the matter.

AudienceHallBanite_001_3.speaker: Player
AudienceHallBanite_001_3.text: This place looks like a slaughterhouse. What happened?
AudienceHallBanite_001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: Asks about all the dead patriars and their bodyguards.

AudienceHallBanite_001_4.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_4.text: My lord requires a clear path to his magnificent future. We cut away the troublesome bramble.

AudienceHallBanite_001_2.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_2.text: Do not face him without Orin's Netherstone in hand, or you will meet the same end.

AudienceHallBanite_001_6.speaker: Iron Consul Nuff
AudienceHallBanite_001_6.text: Gortash has gone to his chambers. Take the door to the right, through the grating.

Patriar_011_0.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
Patriar_011_0.context: NodeContext: Mumbling a negative response. (Like 'no thanks' or 'nuh-uh'.)

AD_RoofSteelWatchersDead_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_RoofSteelWatchersDead_0.text: A fallen Watcher. Someone would mark me as a fool.

Patriar_004_1.speaker: Baron Callem Bormul
Patriar_004_1.text: A mighty leader, a mighty city.

Patriar_004_2.speaker: Baron Callem Bormul
Patriar_004_2.text: Archduke - quite something, don't you think? I daresay Balduran himself would approve.

AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.text: Friends, allies - to my side. Let us usher in a new dawn!
AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: during combat - self-assuredly calling his allies to his aid, fully expecting victory

AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_1.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_1.text: Steel Watch. Your time has come!
AD_TakingTurn_001_Combat_1.context: NodeContext: during combat, self-assuredly calling his mechanical steel watch to his aid

Patriar_001_0.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
Patriar_001_0.text: Baldur's Gate's in good hands. No army could hope to conquer the Watch.

Patriar_001_3.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
Patriar_001_3.text: The Steel Watch has made an impenetrable fortress out of the Sword Coast's crown jewel.

Patriar_001_2.speaker: Lord Rugger Shattershield
Patriar_001_2.text: Can't think of a better endorsement for Gortash than that.

Patriar_003_0.speaker: Lady Ailis Belt
Patriar_003_0.text: Not now. Gortash has the floor.

Patriar_003_1.speaker: Lady Ailis Belt
Patriar_003_1.text: Baldur's Gate is in good hands.

Patriar_003_2.speaker: Lady Ailis Belt
Patriar_003_2.text: An historic day. The city's first Archduke.

Ceremony_167.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_167.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_383.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_383.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_427.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_427.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_186.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_186.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_70.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_70.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_180.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_180.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_286.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_286.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_211.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_211.context: InternalNodeContext: Contingency node if we need to add extra lines

Ceremony_422.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_422.text: Lord Enver Gortash, the people cry your name. Will you -
Ceremony_422.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to room and then to Gortash as part of speech gesturing his arms enthusiastically.

Ceremony_253.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_253.text: *For the briefest moment, you are one with Duke Ravengard. His mind is void - a vessel of the Absolute, awaiting command.*
Ceremony_253.context: CinematicNodeContext: Mind meld with Ravengard for one node.

Ceremony_437.speaker: Wyll
Ceremony_437.context: NodeContext: Wyll sees his father, surprised.

Ceremony_80.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_80.text: My Lord. We have a guest.

Ceremony_310.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_310.text: Exquisite timing. Dearest patriars, but a moment. Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
Ceremony_310.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks to the room gesturing his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. First line is addressed to the room and second line is addressed to the player.

Ceremony_400.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_400.text: Karlach! My dear, aren't you a sight for sore eyes. How long has it been? Five years? Six? I'm delighted to see you again.

Ceremony_234.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_234.text: From earth do we rise. In fire are we forged. In steel are we mighty!
Ceremony_234.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravengard speaks to the room as the player approaches. Addressed to the room as part of speech from the top of the stairs gesturing his arms enthusiastically and pausing a bit in between each phrases. The players and peanuts walks in.NodeContext: The end of a rousing speech.

Ceremony_275.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
Ceremony_275.text: Stand down, villain. In the name of the Steel Watch.
Ceremony_275.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Steel Watcher blocks the player.

Ceremony_433.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
Ceremony_433.text: Aggressive action will not be tolerated in the presence of the patriars of this proud city.
Ceremony_433.context: CinematicNodeContext: The machine gears up to attack.

Ceremony_184.speaker: Player
Ceremony_184.text: Point taken. I'll keep things peaceful.

Ceremony_382.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
Ceremony_382.text: The Steel Watch appreciate your cooperation, citizen.
Ceremony_382.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

Ceremony_101.speaker: Player
Ceremony_101.text: I'm not taking orders from a piece of metal.

Ceremony_442.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
Ceremony_442.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

Ceremony_162.speaker: GROUP_SteelWatchers
Ceremony_162.text: You will not survive this encounter, citizen.
Ceremony_162.context: CinematicNodeContext: The Watcher stays menacing, ready to attack.NodeContext: Gets new command after starting to engage. Gortash sends a remote command to let the player through.

Ceremony_89.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_89.text: Dearest patriars, but a moment. I must greet a most honoured guest.
Ceremony_89.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to player. Second line, addressed to the room as he excuses himself.NodeContext: Magninamously and a bir formal, but still in the style of a politician where you can't tell if he's being sarcastic

Ceremony_374.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_374.text: Dearest patriars, dearest Ravengard, but a moment. The Blade of Frontiers graces our halls.

Ceremony_288.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_288.text: Crawling back from their bloody disgrace - it's my favourite assassin! Gods, you're a sight for sore eyes.
Ceremony_288.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. Steelwatcher goes back to neutral friendly position.

Ceremony_274.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_274.text: Orin told me she made a fool of you, but I should've known you wouldn't go down that easy.

Ceremony_30.speaker: Player
Ceremony_30.text: I have no clue what you're talking about - my memories are blighted.

Ceremony_115.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_115.text: Then she didn't lie - the past is lost to you. Let me clear up some mysteries, then. We share so much history.

Ceremony_271.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_271.text: You and I initiated this plot. We discussed in depth the failures of our predecessors and how to avoid them.

Ceremony_280.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_280.text: We understood that if we were to unite, no one could stand in the way of the Dead Three.

Ceremony_376.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_376.text: So unite we did. First we obtained the crown; then we enslaved the brain. From there, it was but a small step to the most successful religious hoax ever perpetrated.

Ceremony_402.speaker: Player
Ceremony_402.text: What does the cult of the Absolute have to do with this?

Ceremony_367.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_367.text: It was all going so well - until you vanished. Orin informed us that henceforth she would speak for the temple of Bhaal, and act on their behalf.

Ceremony_95.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_95.text: But she made a mess of things. Unlike you, she cannot control herself.

Ceremony_232.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_232.text: Hang on. What the fuck is going on here?
Ceremony_232.context: NodeContext: incredulous to find that the dark urge avatqar and Gortash have a long history together

Ceremony_381.speaker: Player
Ceremony_381.text: You misread me. I've come to end this evil plot.

Ceremony_352.speaker: Player
Ceremony_352.text: You are mistaken if you think I can control myself.

Ceremony_227.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_227.text: Have you gone soft? I find that hard to believe. One's true nature always rises to the top.

Ceremony_159.speaker: Player
Ceremony_159.text: I'm back now, and a reckoning awaits.

Ceremony_397.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_397.text: Indeed you are. Look at you - cold-blooded as ever.

Ceremony_6.speaker: Player
Ceremony_6.text: How dare Orin take my place. I'll make her pay.

Ceremony_26.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_26.text: Good, good. I can see you are still your old self.

Ceremony_5.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_5.text: When Ketheric fell, I feared the worst. That our plans would fail like so many before. Because of discord among ourselves.

Ceremony_69.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_69.text: Now you've returned, we can achieve all of our dreams still. You brought Thorm's Netherstone.

Ceremony_10.speaker: Player
Ceremony_10.text: I don't remember a thing, but the plan sounds brilliant!

Ceremony_155.speaker: Player
Ceremony_155.text: What was my role in this plan?

Ceremony_405.speaker: Player
Ceremony_405.text: Ask the Emperor: Is he telling the truth?

Ceremony_200.speaker: Player
Ceremony_200.text: I like your tone! But humour me: I have amnesia.

Ceremony_100.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_100.text: My friend - forgive the cold welcome. My Steel Watchers are eager watchdogs. For the good of the people, I'm sure you understand.
Ceremony_100.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash looks to player and smiles wide. He speaks his arms enthusiastically while walking down the stairs to get closer to the player. Steelwatcher goes back to neutral friendly position.NodeContext: Politician through and through. Charismatic enough to understand how he's so popular. Sllimy enough for his bad faith to shine through,

Ceremony_368.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_368.text: But - my stars! That can't be my old friend Karlach, can it? How long has it been? Five years? Six? I'm delighted to see you again.

Ceremony_68.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_68.text: Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
Ceremony_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash boes deeply as he introduces himself

Ceremony_173.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_173.text: I understand congratulations are in order. Thorm's defeat hasn't gone unnoticed. You're known - for who you are, and for that Netherstone that you carry.

Ceremony_154.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_154.text: Ah - and my old friend Karlach. It's no wonder your victory was so decisive. It's lovely to see you again, darling.

Ceremony_166.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_166.context: NodeContext: Rictus grin trying not to rip his head off

Ceremony_414.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_414.text: We'll catch up once we've covered more pressing matters - Thorm's Netherstone, more to the point.

Ceremony_330.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_330.text: I knew I'd meet Ketheric's slayer eventually, but I had no idea it was you, Karlach.

Ceremony_177.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_177.text: You have Thorm's Netherstone. We must discuss what that means.

Ceremony_254.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_254.text: You know, it takes all three to control the brain. Without Thorm's, it's become vexingly wilful.
Ceremony_254.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises his gauntlet, in which the netherstone gem gleams. He gazes upon it with awe as he turns his arm about before lowering his arm again.

Ceremony_270.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_270.text: The quakes are a clear warning. If nobody steps in soon, it'll free itself from the authority of the crown.

Ceremony_49.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_49.text: I expect it'll start with turning the Sword Coast's infected - you among them. That Prism of yours won't last indefinitely.

Ceremony_168.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_168.text: Next, the Grand Design. The mind flayer empire reborn. If we're lucky, we'll become slaves. If we're unlucky, well -

Ceremony_40.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_40.text: A bleak prospect. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I renew our old partnership.

Ceremony_31.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_31.text: Not the most thrilling of prospects. But it's a fate that can be avoided if you and I come to an understanding.

Ceremony_112.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_112.text: You may have wrought the destruction of my Iron Throne, brought my Steel Watch to its knees - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

Ceremony_39.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_39.text: You may have wrought the destruction of my Iron Throne - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

Ceremony_50.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_50.text: Together we can still restore authority over the brain.

Ceremony_1.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Ceremony_1.text: Of course. Gortash always did have an eye for opportunity...
Ceremony_1.context:
NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present (speaking directly into player's mind)
Reflecting on the fact that Gortash is now proposing an alliance with the player. Hates Gortash though, so this is with an edge of resentment.

Ceremony_388.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_388.text: You should know better than most, Karlach, the risks of falling out of my favour.

Ceremony_398.speaker: Player
Ceremony_398.text: What kind of partnership do you have in mind?

Ceremony_379.speaker: Player
Ceremony_379.text: What kind of understanding do you suggest?

Ceremony_446.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_446.text: There is an old wisdom: a brittle alliance can never be mended - it can only break.

Ceremony_7.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_7.text: With Ketheric felled, Orin proves treacherous. She craves the Netherstones for her own, desperate to impress Bhaal.

Ceremony_202.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_202.text: She only cares for blood. And your blood and mine are of particular interest to her.

Ceremony_394.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_394.text: You've met her assassins. Efficient killers by all accounts. I know you survived previous encounters. But she won't relent.

Ceremony_17.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_17.text: Her assassins hunt you even now. They are very efficient killers. Even someone with your talents should take heed.

Ceremony_158.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_158.text: Orin changes shape faster than you and I change clothes. You know. She's tricked you before.

Ceremony_34.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_34.text: She's targeted me as well. I'm well protected, but she's extremely good at what she does.

Ceremony_216.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_216.text: If Orin obtains all three Netherstones, she'll plunge the Coast into chaos and paint the city in blood.

Ceremony_118.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_118.text: I can't let that happen. I want to lead this city to glory - not scorch its earth.

Ceremony_284.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_284.text: So I turn to the scion of Bhaal. You are his dear Sovereign - he created you to rule.

Ceremony_435.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_435.text: Let's make our pact anew. A divine oath, sworn upon spirit and flesh. I do no harm to you, nor you to me.

Ceremony_246.speaker: Player
Ceremony_246.text: It's going to take a lot to make me trust you.

Ceremony_218.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_218.text: So I turn to you, the former ruler of the cult of Bhaal.

Ceremony_109.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_109.text: I'd like to propose a pact. A divine oath, sworn upon spirit and flesh. I do no harm to you, nor you to me.

Ceremony_163.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_163.text: Furthermore, you'll have nothing to fear from my Steel Watch while our pact stands.

Ceremony_151.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_151.text: Thorm's stone is yours to keep. When you slay Orin and take her stone, you bring it here, so the three are united once again.

Ceremony_53.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_53.text: Together we rule Faerûn as kings. No, more than kings - gods. We rule as the Absolute.

Ceremony_294.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_294.text: *The Urge, the deplorably brutal Urge sickens within you. When you level the world over, that dead world must be yours alone.*

Ceremony_219.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_219.text: *But first you will rule. Then, you will ruin.*

Ceremony_426.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_426.text: What do you say? Shall we be allies?

Ceremony_281.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Ceremony_281.text: I can detect no deceit. This alliance could serve us well. And if it does not... well, we need not honour it.
Ceremony_281.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present

Ceremony_123.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Ceremony_123.text: He lies. He means to betray you. But this need not preclude an alliance. You could be the one to betray him.
Ceremony_123.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present

Ceremony_449.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_449.text: 'Let's be allies,' said the viper to the frog.

Ceremony_14.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Ceremony_14.text: He wants what we want - Orin dead, and the elder brain subjugated. An alliance would serve us well.

Ceremony_36.speaker: Player
Ceremony_36.text: Orin betrayed me, and you did nothing to help me then. What has changed?

Ceremony_79.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_79.text: We would not meddle in each other's affairs - this was our agreement. She came to us as Bhaal's Chosen. We are but servants to our lords.

Ceremony_15.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_15.text: Your presence here means your lord sees a purpose for you yet.

Ceremony_78.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_78.text: I tolerated Orin, but I liked you.

Ceremony_60.speaker: Player
Ceremony_60.text: I seem to have trusted you once, and it ruined me. I'm not about to repeat that mistake.

Ceremony_77.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_77.text: I am not Orin; I know the value of alliance. Bane teaches his followers to reward those who support his chosen, not to betray them.

Ceremony_98.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_98.text: You and I always knew we could only stand against the world united.

Ceremony_237.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_237.text: Orin's blind ambition failed us. She compromised you, just when success seemed certain. Ketheric? His obsession with his daughter made him lose all hold on reason.

Ceremony_299.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_299.text: They floundered, even as they tried to rise above us. We will not, can not make that mistake if we come together in trust.

Ceremony_418.speaker: Player
Ceremony_418.text: As allies, it seems none of you can be trusted. You, Orin, Ketheric.

Ceremony_302.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_302.text: So Ketheric was ready to betray our alliance, too?

Ceremony_51.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_51.text: I can't say it comes as a surprise. But you should know this:

Ceremony_8.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_8.text: I initiated this plot. I brought Ketheric and Orin together to create the Absolute.

Ceremony_421.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_421.text: They knew this would only work if we stood united and coordinated our powers.

Ceremony_91.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_91.text: Their ambition blinded them to reason. I don't suffer the same affliction.

Ceremony_393.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_393.text: In short - you can trust me.

Ceremony_178.speaker: Player
Ceremony_178.text: I will defeat Orin and we shall be allies. You have my oath.

Ceremony_107.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_107.text: Then let it be writ by the Black Hand of Bane. I, Lord Enver Gortash, swear I shall do you no harm. We will rise together over Toril as a roaring sun.

Ceremony_343.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_343.text: This isn't going to end well. Mark my words.

Ceremony_145.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_145.text: I understand your concerns, my old friend, but allow me to demonstrate why you made the right choice.

Ceremony_131.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_131.text: Let me demonstrate why you made the right choice.

Ceremony_9.speaker: Player
Ceremony_9.text: I'll think about it. No promises.

Ceremony_153.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_153.text: Perhaps a demonstration of why you need my help will motivate you to make the right decision.

Ceremony_384.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_384.text: Your camp is compromised. One among you is an impostor. A Faceless.

Ceremony_262.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_262.text: Who, I can't say. I'd suggest a thorough investigation - you'll find I speak truth.

Ceremony_389.speaker: Lae'zel
Ceremony_389.text: A doppelganger - hidden among us? Tsk'va!

Ceremony_233.speaker: Shadowheart
Ceremony_233.text: A doppelganger in our camp? That sounds all too believable.

Ceremony_425.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_425.text: Take that with a grain of salt. This is Gortash we're talking to.

Ceremony_342.speaker: Minsc
Ceremony_342.text: Don't look at me. And don't you dare look at Boo.
Ceremony_342.context: NodeContext: Player looking to him after being told there's a shapeshifter among us. First line is shrugged, nonchalant. Second line is genuinely offended, mildly aghast that it might even occur to us

Ceremony_87.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_87.text: A shapeshifter? It could be anyone.

Ceremony_136.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_136.text: I mean - it's not me, but it could be anyone else.
Ceremony_136.context: NodeContext: Follows "A shape-shifter? It could be anyone."

Ceremony_88.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_88.text: The faceless in your camp is like a knife at your throat. Remove it, quickly, or any alliance between us would be exceedingly short-lived.

Ceremony_43.speaker: Player
Ceremony_43.text: The faceless in my camp was Orin herself. She took someone - I need to find her.

Ceremony_0.speaker: Player
Ceremony_0.text: How am I supposed to find Orin if she can change her form so easily?

Ceremony_430.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_430.text: Even horror has a home. Find her nest, and slay her there.

Ceremony_377.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_377.text: The Bhaal Temple, your old haunt, now reeks of her ichors.

Ceremony_291.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_291.text: Hm. Do you even remember how to find it?

Ceremony_122.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_122.text: It's a secret even to me.

Ceremony_242.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_242.text: You're resourceful - I trust you'll sniff it out. If the trail goes cold, follow the bodies.

Ceremony_149.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_149.text: For all its charms, Baldur's Gate has long had a cancer at its heart - a hidden temple, devoted to Bhaal.

Ceremony_104.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_104.text: That's where Orin became what she is, where she worshipped and schemed.

Ceremony_279.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_279.text: And now it's where she hides from my Watchers when she's not spilling blood in the streets.

Ceremony_143.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_143.text: And now it's where she hides from me when she's not spilling blood in the streets.

Ceremony_269.speaker: Player
Ceremony_269.text: Me, you, Ketheric, the brain. What was the plan before Orin interfered?

Ceremony_239.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_239.text: In Bhaal's name, you set your bloody daggers to cause panic in the streets, killing in the Absolute's name.

Ceremony_419.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_419.text: You would have carried out that part of the plan, had Orin not ruined your hard work.

Ceremony_304.speaker: Player
Ceremony_304.text: You, Orin, Ketheric, the brain. What was your plan?
