Ceremony_346.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_346.text: First, Orin the Red, bloody dagger of Bhaal, causes panic in the streets through killings in the Absolute's name.

Ceremony_81.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_81.text: Next, the threat of the Absolute's monstrous armies formed by Myrkul's general, Ketheric Thorm.

Ceremony_86.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_86.text: In such circumstances, people crave strong leaders. Leaders that bring law, order, and protection. Leaders like me, Bane's unyielding hand, author of justice.

Ceremony_354.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_354.text: You are soon to witness the people of Baldur's Gate granting me complete power over them. All out of fear of the Absolute.

Ceremony_399.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_399.text: Next, I - we - will declare curfew and begin infecting the masses. Our subjects will hear the voice of their Absolute god.

Ceremony_373.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_373.text: The faithful will do anything in the name of their god.

Ceremony_241.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_241.text: Yes, yes, I'm sure I do.

Ceremony_300.speaker: Player
Ceremony_300.text: Glorious. Then let us be gods, you and I.

Ceremony_59.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_59.text: You already are, in your blood. It is simply a matter of getting the world to see it.

Ceremony_174.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_174.text: Our tyranny. And we are saviours. Defenders of the Sword Coast. Our loyal subjects will love us, not hate us.

Ceremony_55.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_55.text: What comes next will be entirely their fault.

Ceremony_67.speaker: Player
Ceremony_67.text: Where in the Nine Hells did you find a powerful artefact like the crown?

Ceremony_272.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_272.text: Powerful connections. Let's leave it at that.

Ceremony_4.speaker: Player
Ceremony_4.text: I've heard enough. Am I free to go?

Ceremony_38.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_38.text: Soon. First, come and be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

Ceremony_309.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_309.text: Now come, be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

Ceremony_371.speaker: Player
Ceremony_371.text: I'd rather juice my own eyes.

Ceremony_370.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_370.text: Be that as it may, you will sit quietly and watch as history is made.

Ceremony_97.speaker: Player
Ceremony_97.text: I wouldn't dream of missing it.

Ceremony_358.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_358.text: Then we proceed. The patriars await.

Ceremony_441.speaker: Player
Ceremony_441.text: Fine. Let's get it over with.

Ceremony_349.speaker: Player
Ceremony_349.text: I have no interest in this sham of a ceremony.

Ceremony_326.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_326.text: This is the first step towards our glory. I really must insist.

Ceremony_366.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_366.text: Then allow me to pique it for you.

Ceremony_191.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_191.text: *Your brain twists and stretches under the Watcher's gaze. The pain almost brings you to your knees before fading.*
Ceremony_191.context: CinematicNodeContext: The camera shows a nearby steel watcher. It twists your brain into knots. Player is in agonizing pain, gripping their head, then releasing it at the end as the watcher releases its hold on you.

Ceremony_217.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_217.text: You will follow me. And you will show due respect.

Ceremony_249.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_249.text: Distinguished dukes, patriars. Dearest Ravengard - I will heed your call. A new chapter begins.
Ceremony_249.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash walks from the player and addresses the partriars in the room beforemaking a 180 turn with his back to player. Player and peanuts stepping back.

Ceremony_236.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash approaches Ravengard. Ravengard nods and steps forward. He holds a sword aloft - the sword of Balduran, perhaps. Gortash kneels, back to player. Everyone takes position for the Archduke ceremony.

Ceremony_411.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_411.text: Enver Gortash. Swearest thou, by Balduran's blade, to defend the citizens of Baldur's Gate from enemies within and without?
Ceremony_411.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash is kneeling and looking down. Ravenguard put the blade on top of Gortash's left shoulder and hold that position.

Ceremony_392.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_392.context: NodeContext: Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down.

Ceremony_365.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_365.text: Swearest thou true faith and fealty to the same, by word, deed, and decree, so that none may suffer?
Ceremony_365.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravenguard move to top of the blade from Gortash left shoulder to his right shoulder. Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down (looping idle)

Ceremony_243.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_243.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ravenguard goes back in loop idle with the weapon pointing down from Gortash right shoulder.NodeContext: Gortadsh is still kneeling looking down.

Ceremony_417.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_417.context: NodeContext: Ravenguard is in loop idle weapon pointing down.

Ceremony_263.speaker: Player
Ceremony_263.text: There is no more evil bastard in all of Baldur's Gate than this prick! Do not swear him in as your ruler.

Ceremony_92.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_92.text: Pay no mind to this madwoman. She's a jealous old hanger-on who'd ruin me for the crime of my success in protecting our fair city.

Ceremony_23.speaker: Player
Ceremony_23.text: Stop this. Gortash and Ravengard are with the Absolute!

Ceremony_325.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Ceremony_325.text: Don't. You'll only invite his ire. And your own death.
Ceremony_325.context: NodeContext: telepathic, Emperor not physically present (speaking directly into player's head)

Ceremony_313.speaker: Lae'zel
Ceremony_313.text: Hold your tongue. This horde could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

Ceremony_194.speaker: Shadowheart
Ceremony_194.text: Silence can be very powerful, you know. Especially when it saves our lives.
Ceremony_194.context: NodeContext: 'Please don't cause a scene/pick a fight we can't win' Aside to player

Ceremony_210.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_210.text: Hang on - we're at a strategic disadvantage here. Better to take down those machines, then rip Gortash's throat out.

Ceremony_139.speaker: Minsc
Ceremony_139.text: Speak, friend! They may have overwhelming numbers, but the glorious deaths will be ours.
Ceremony_139.context: NodeContext: A quiet aside, revving up for battle. Player is about to speak and pick a very tough fight by doing so (some other companions warn against it) Aside to player

Ceremony_298.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_298.text: I know that look: the 'I'm about to do something incredibly stupid' look. There are enough of them to turn us into paste, so maybe don't? Just this once.
Ceremony_298.context: NodeContext: An aside to the player

Ceremony_61.speaker: Wyll
Ceremony_61.text: Keep calm, I beg you. If we do battle, my father will perish at our own hands.

Ceremony_192.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_192.text: Enver Gortash. The Council appoints you Archduke of Baldur's Gate.
Ceremony_192.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash raises the sword still pojnting down to conclude the ceremony.

Ceremony_290.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_290.text: My friends - today, a new covenant is forged. Together, we will stand against the evil forces plaguing our dear city!
Ceremony_290.context: NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

Ceremony_120.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_120.text: And you, honoured guest, will find me in my office above when you return. Do not come empty-handed.
Ceremony_120.context: NodeContext: Addressed to player after speaking to assembled audience.

Ceremony_362.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_362.text: My friends. The Steel Watch stands ready. Let its blade fall on any who would diminish our city!
Ceremony_362.context: CinematicNodeContext: He speaks his arms enthusiastically. Addressed to the crowd.  Gortash stands pleased and turns right 180 to player and smiles.NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

Ceremony_20.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_20.text: My friends - today, a new covenant is forged. Together, we will stand against the evil forces plaguing our dear city!
Ceremony_20.context: NodeContext: Spoken to all attendees of the ceremony.

Ceremony_301.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_301.text: Follow me to my office above. We can be good for each other.
Ceremony_301.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash walks close the right side of the player a bit past him and look by his shoulder to address him. And then walks on after delevering the line.NodeContext: Addressed to the player, more close to himm not looking at him.

Ceremony_406.speaker: Player
Ceremony_406.text: Stop this. Gortash and Ravengard are with the Absolute!

Ceremony_82.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ceremony_82.text: A traitor's words - they mean to fracture this Council!

Ceremony_45.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_45.text: Watchers - to arms. The War of the Absolute has begun.
Ceremony_45.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash stands up angrily and the steelwatcher are gearing up for combat.

Ceremony_169.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_169.text: Patriars - let it be known. The War of the Absolute has begun.
Ceremony_169.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gortash stands up and the steelwatcher are gearing up for combat.

Ceremony_126.speaker: Gale
Ceremony_126.text: Let's take a breath - the odds are stacked against us if we try to pick a fight now.

Ceremony_267.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_267.text: *Doubts cloud your mind. This is not a battle you're likely to win.*

Ceremony_431.speaker: Lae'zel
Ceremony_431.text: Hold your tongue. Gortash and his allies could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

Ceremony_340.speaker: Shadowheart
Ceremony_340.text: Silence can be an excellent tool, you know. Especially if it spares you an unwinnable fight.
Ceremony_340.context: NodeContext: 'Please don't cause a scene/pick a fight we can't win' Aside to player

Ceremony_185.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_185.text: The machines might be scrap. But that doesn't mean we've got the advantage.

Ceremony_235.speaker: Minsc
Ceremony_235.text: Speak, friend! The overwhelming numbers are theirs, but the glorious deaths will be ours.
Ceremony_235.context: NodeContext: A quiet aside, revving up for battle. Player is about to speak and pick a very tough fight by doing so (some other companions warn against it) Aside to player

Ceremony_297.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_297.text: I know that look: the 'I'm about to do something incredibly stupid' look. There are enough of them to turn us into paste, so maybe don't? Just this once.
Ceremony_297.context: NodeContext: An aside to the player

Ceremony_135.speaker: Wyll
Ceremony_135.text: Keep calm, I beg you. If we do battle, my father will perish at our own hands.

Ceremony_3.speaker: Gale
Ceremony_3.text: Let's let cooler heads prevail, eh? I'm not sure I like our odds if we pick a fight here.

Ceremony_90.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_90.text: *Doubts cloud your mind. This is not a battle you're likely to win.*

Ceremony_24.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_24.text: The young Ravengard is with the Absolute. He means to disrupt this council.

Ceremony_148.speaker: Player
Ceremony_148.text: This stops now Gortash. I'm taking you out.

Ceremony_117.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_117.text: It's not. But it will not follow new orders unless the Netherstones are united to give the command.

Ceremony_331.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_331.text: When it finishes executing its current orders, it will be free to do as it wishes. That would be bad for everyone.

Ceremony_240.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_240.text: The crown's magic turned the brain into something the world has never seen - a Netherbrain. Its power is immense.

Ceremony_359.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_359.text: Once it is freed from its shackles, I doubt we'll ever be able to bring it under control again.

Ceremony_12.speaker: Player
Ceremony_12.text: Surely your Steel Watch can handle Orin. Why do you need me?

Ceremony_144.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_144.text: Orin is... elusive, shall we say. The grip of the Steel Watch may be tight, but sand still slips through its fingers.

Ceremony_289.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_289.text: Some conflicts are best resolved quietly. The people are cattle: obedient until panicked.

Ceremony_444.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_444.text: You carry the stone plucked from Myrkul's Chosen, besides. Why call you 'enemy' when I could repair an old friendship?

Ceremony_56.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_56.text: You carry the stone plucked from Myrkul's Chosen, besides. I am not ready to call you 'enemy'.

Ceremony_295.speaker: Player
Ceremony_295.text: Surely the Flaming Fist could handle Orin. Why do you need me?

Ceremony_323.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_323.text: Orin is... slippery, shall we say. She even eluded my Steel Watch - before you destroyed it.

Ceremony_150.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_150.text: She would slip like sand through the Flaming Fist's fingers.

Ceremony_66.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_66.text: Before you do, come witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

Ceremony_230.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_230.text: Let this be a warning. Orin will be your downfall, or you will be hers. We make an alliance, and you will be the victor.

Ceremony_201.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_201.text: Let this be a warning. Orin is the spark in a powderkeg. We make an alliance - or the city is made ash.

Ceremony_255.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_255.text: I will give you time to reconsider.

Ceremony_336.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
Ceremony_336.text: Tread carefully. Remember, you must do what it takes to survive. Even if it means striking a deal with the enemy.

Ceremony_258.speaker: Player
Ceremony_258.text: The brain, the crown, it will all be mine. And I won't share.

Ceremony_113.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_113.text: Orin was right - you're playing the fool. With all the unthinking greed of your god.

Ceremony_338.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_338.text: Oh, but I most certainly am not.

Ceremony_141.speaker: Player
Ceremony_141.text: You're a dead man. I can't let you take over the city.

Ceremony_248.speaker: Lae'zel
Ceremony_248.text: Calm yourself. These Watchers could bring even a mounted kith'rak to her knees.

Ceremony_108.speaker: Shadowheart
Ceremony_108.text: No. Those Watchers are liable to turn us into cat food if we move a muscle.
Ceremony_108.context: NodeContext: 'don't be rash - we're outgunned' - Aside to player

Ceremony_33.speaker: Karlach
Ceremony_33.text: Hang on - we're at a strategic disadvantage here. Better to take down those machines, then rip Gortash's throat out.

Ceremony_121.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_121.text: Sage advice. My Steel Watchers take unkindly to threats - no matter how hollow.
Ceremony_121.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera moves in on a nearby Steel Watcher automaton.

Ceremony_124.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_124.text: You are of little use to me dead, but dead is exactly what you will be if you arouse the ire of my Steel Watch.

Ceremony_356.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_356.text: Such pluck! How I admire it. Alas, I take unkindly to threats - no matter how hollow.
Ceremony_356.context: CinematicNodeContext: Camera moves in on a nearby Steel Watcher automaton.

Ceremony_277.speaker: Minsc
Ceremony_277.text: You've kept your honour, friend. Even if our enemy has every other advantage.
Ceremony_277.context: NodeContext: Approving - meant to be a more mildly humorous than dramatic. We've chosen to pick a very tough fight in which we'll surely die - Minsc is communicating that, but with satisfied approval. Aside to player

Ceremony_175.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_175.text: You're bluffing, right? Because those contraptions could turn us to paste.

Ceremony_205.speaker: Wyll
Ceremony_205.text: Please, stay your hand. My father's life is at stake.

Ceremony_410.speaker: Gale
Ceremony_410.text: Don't - we'd face very poor odds if you start a fight now.

Ceremony_317.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_317.text: *Doubt casts a shadow on your mind. You've little chance to best Gortash's Steel Watchers.*

Ceremony_353.speaker: Player
Ceremony_353.text: I am ending this here, consequences be damned.

Ceremony_287.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_287.text: Tut. So much potential, gone to waste. Watchers - the Absolute's assassins walk among us!
Ceremony_287.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gearing up for combat.NodeContext: "Tut" read aloud like a word (as opposed to a dental click).

Ceremony_133.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_133.text: Tut. So much potential, gone to waste. Patriars - let it be known. The Absolute's assassins walk among us!
Ceremony_133.context: CinematicNodeContext: Gearing up for combat.NodeContext: "Tut" read aloud like a word (as opposed to a dental click).

Ceremony_21.speaker: Wyll
Ceremony_21.text: An impostor? But who in the Hells...

Ceremony_220.speaker: Gale
Ceremony_220.text: A doppelganger in our camp? A little redundant of me to say, but that could be anyone.

Ceremony_206.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_206.text: As vulgar as ever, I see.

Ceremony_293.speaker: Player
Ceremony_293.text: To the hells with your pact.

Ceremony_395.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_395.text: What a shame to refuse the power of a god.

Ceremony_94.speaker: Player
Ceremony_94.text: What about my father? What will happen to him?

Ceremony_72.speaker: Player
Ceremony_72.text: Examine Gortash's body language and expressions. Can you trust him?

Ceremony_103.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_103.text: *Gortash's eyes blink in a consistent rhythm. He stands calmly, confidently. He fully intends to share his kingdom with you.*

Ceremony_152.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_152.text: *You note a flicker in Gortash's eyes. You have already destroyed that which he held dear. His promises are empty ones.*

Ceremony_130.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_130.text: Orin is unreliable. This one - this one shows promise. They keep their word, I keep mine. We will rule as one.
Ceremony_130.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

Ceremony_229.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_229.text: This wretch has left destruction in their wake, made me a mockery. They will bring me the Netherstone - and then I will crush them.
Ceremony_229.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

Ceremony_347.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_347.context: CinematicNodeContext: Detect Thought (Lead In | Lead Out)

Ceremony_387.speaker: Astarion
Ceremony_387.text: An ally could be useful, at least for now. And when he's no longer useful - well, we can dispose of him then.

Ceremony_105.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_105.text: Your father will do whatever you command him to, like any other subject in our kingdom.

Ceremony_303.speaker: Narrator
Ceremony_303.text: *Darkness stirs in you. Bhaal demands blood - and there is none blacker than that of Orin, his own Chosen.*

Ceremony_157.speaker: Player
Ceremony_157.text: You want me to believe you mean no harm to the city?

Ceremony_127.speaker: Player
Ceremony_127.text: It's going to take a lot to make me trust you.

Ceremony_213.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_213.text: Orin changes shape faster than you and I change clothes. She might be anywhere.

Ceremony_73.speaker: Player
Ceremony_73.text: If she wants my blood, she'll have to find me first.

Ceremony_440.speaker: Player
Ceremony_440.text: Perhaps she and I can be allies.

Ceremony_423.speaker: Player
Ceremony_423.text: I will bring her to heel.

Ceremony_85.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_85.text: With Ketheric gone, Orin proves treacherous. She wants the Netherstones for herself.

Ceremony_447.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_447.text: With Ketheric gone, Orin proved treacherous. Bhaal's Chosen wants the Netherstones for herself.

Ceremony_319.speaker: Player
Ceremony_319.text: I want to avenge myself. I want to strike at Orin.

Ceremony_208.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_208.text: Ousting Orin and helping you reclaim your birthright would be my greatest honour.

Ceremony_2.speaker: Player
Ceremony_2.text: I'm a changed person, I'm not siding with you ever again.

Ceremony_320.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_320.text: Bhaal isn't done with you, you must know that. You have effortless talents, killing instinctually like you breathe blood.

Ceremony_311.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_311.text: Stand with Bhaal, or it will spell your doom. But I can offer some aid for the storm you are about to weather.

Ceremony_327.speaker: Player
Ceremony_327.text: I'm not interested in bargaining with the likes of you.

Ceremony_415.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_415.text: The likes of you stand to benefit from the likes of me.

Ceremony_222.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_222.text: You may have brought my Steel Watch to its knees - but that's how I know you'd make a most formidable ally.

Ceremony_345.speaker: Player
Ceremony_345.text: You're awfully friendly for the man who sold me to a devil ten years ago.

Ceremony_363.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_363.text: Time flies, doesn't it? But never mind that - we have much to discuss. You have a Netherstone. That makes us allies.

Ceremony_225.speaker: Player
Ceremony_225.text: Discuss? Ha. I've come to burn your head off your body.

Ceremony_312.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_312.text: Now, now, Karlach, let's not be hasty. We've begun something far greater than that temper of yours. You have a Netherstone. That bears discussion.

Ceremony_351.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_351.text: Ah! My dear friend, what a brilliant child you've been to your Father. It must feel good to be the favourite. Orin must still be screaming in the Hells.

Ceremony_314.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_314.text: Ah - and my old friend Karlach. It's no wonder your victory was so decisive. How have you been, darling?

Ceremony_84.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_84.text: Let's catch up later, hmm? We have more important business.
Ceremony_84.context: NodeContext: Rictus grin trying not to rip his head off

Ceremony_333.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_333.text: My master admires you, as I always have. For the slaughter you bring, and for the Netherstones you bear.

Ceremony_57.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_57.text: My master knows you - for who you are, and for the Netherstones that you carry.

Ceremony_93.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_93.text: Oh, yes - we've much to discuss. But first, come and be witness as I make history as the first Archduke of Baldur's Gate.

Ceremony_228.speaker: Player
Ceremony_228.text: You have so much to answer for. You think I want to watch you become an Archduke?

Ceremony_11.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_11.text: We can discuss personal matters another time, Karlach. Believe me, you won't like what happens if you think to challenge me here, now.

Ceremony_428.speaker: Player
Ceremony_428.text: Let the ceremony begin. I wouldn't dream of missing it.

Ceremony_125.speaker: Player
Ceremony_125.text: Fine. Let's get this sham coronation over with.

Ceremony_188.speaker: Player
Ceremony_188.text: How about I take your head instead?

Ceremony_62.speaker: Player
Ceremony_62.text: I killed her to make amends for my past. You are next.

Ceremony_436.speaker: Player
Ceremony_436.text: I am ending this here, consequences be damned.

Ceremony_364.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_364.text: And you are: a marvel. You've brought Ketheric to his knees and made Orin grovel.

Ceremony_429.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
Ceremony_429.text: Lord Enver Gortash at your service.
Ceremony_429.context: CinematicNodeContext: Addressed to the player, does a Lord Farquaad kind of bow.

Servant_004_1.speaker: Servant Naiske
Servant_004_1.text: I am at my lady's service, and hers alone.

Servant_004_2.speaker: Servant Naiske
Servant_004_2.text: I beg your pardon, but have some decorum.

PAD_LearnedCeremony_0.speaker: Player
PAD_LearnedCeremony_0.text: Gortash is being named Archduke? Time to pay Wyrm's Rock a visit.

AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_2P_0.speaker: Player
AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_2P_0.text: What? That should not have been a lethal blow!

AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_2P_1.speaker: Player
AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_2P_1.text: Hells! Is this the Absolute's doing?

AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.text: You chose to suffer. You chose to die.
AD_TakingTurn_003_Combat_0.context: NodeContext: in combat, condescendingly pitying his opponents

AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_1P_0.speaker: Player
AD_RavengardDiesInFlames_1P_0.text: What? The Absolute's doing - that should not have been a lethal blow!

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_003_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_003_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

AD_BodyguardsDead_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_BodyguardsDead_0.text: Dead. My enemies lurk in the shadows.

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_006_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_006_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

Patriar_002_1.speaker: Lady Alia Durinbold
Patriar_002_1.text: Ravengard has not once failed this city. If he trusts Gortash, then so do I.

Patriar_002_2.speaker: Lady Alia Durinbold
Patriar_002_2.text: You'll remember this day. History's been made, in this very fortress.

Servant_003_0.speaker: Servant Kavell
Servant_003_0.text: My lady does not permit idle chatter.

Servant_003_1.speaker: Servant Kavell
Servant_003_1.text: Away, if you please. I am here at the service of Lady Birch.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_4.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_4.text: Gortash will likely call on me soon - I've sent him many a business proposal.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_12.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_12.text: Do invite me along, darling. We could have afternoon tea!

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_1.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_1.text: Lady Winstra, we'll be discussing business - hardly your realm of expertise.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_8.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_8.text: I could say the same thing about you, darling.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_5.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_5.text: Business has been slow, but it is hardly my fault! This 'Absolute' has people in a flap!

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_11.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_11.text: Every gala, ball, and brunch has been cancelled due to that nuisance of a cult! It's a disaster.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_10.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_10.text: I think Gortash is more concerned about the economy than he is your parties, my lady.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_7.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_7.text: I'd love an evening with Gortash. He's be a most fascinating host, I'd wager.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_0.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_0.text: More fun than Ravengard, for sure.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_9.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_9.text: A man like Gortash knows the path to people's hearts - a glorious evening of drinks and dancing..

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_3.speaker: Lord Randolf Vammas
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_3.text: So long as business comes first - parties don't pay for themselves.

AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_2.speaker: Lady Winstra Hullhollyn
AD_PatriarsDiscussRecentEvents_2.text: They do when I throw them.

AD_PatriarAndServant_0.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_0.text: Naiske, bring me a plate of the cold-water pike.

AD_PatriarAndServant_4.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_4.text: The cook has prepared no pike today, my lady.

AD_PatriarAndServant_8.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_8.text: A most grievous error. In that case, fetch me a bowl of sunfish-head stew.

AD_PatriarAndServant_13.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_13.text: The kitchen is fresh out of sunfish, my lady.

AD_PatriarAndServant_3.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_3.context: NodeContext: Shocked in an entirely upper-class way

AD_PatriarAndServant_6.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_6.text: I so fancy a glass of Dragondew. Fetch me a bottle, and be quick about it.

AD_PatriarAndServant_2.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_2.text: At once, my lady. Would you...

AD_PatriarAndServant_10.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_10.text: Ah, never you mind - a young Pink Clarry would more suit the occasion. Bring it at once.

AD_PatriarAndServant_1.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_1.text: Pink Clarry it is, my good lady.

AD_PatriarAndServant_7.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_7.text: Ah, but perhaps a mint wine. My palate needs cleansing. Though I've grown quite fond of Evermead...

AD_PatriarAndServant_12.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_12.text: If that is all, my lady -

AD_PatriarAndServant_5.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_5.text: Cheese. Something cut fresh from the wheel.

AD_PatriarAndServant_9.speaker: Servant Naiske
AD_PatriarAndServant_9.text: I'll have to inquire with Cook Darlie about...

AD_PatriarAndServant_11.speaker: Lady Madeline Whitburn
AD_PatriarAndServant_11.text: Ah, Naiske. Why must you make everything such a bother?

Servant_001_0.speaker: Footman Dinu
Servant_001_0.text: I can attend only to my lord.

Servant_001_1.speaker: Footman Dinu
Servant_001_1.text: I may speak only to my lord. Terribly sorry.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_3.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_3.text: After enduring Ravengard's slovenly manners for so long, I was rather hoping our next duke might be of high-born stock.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_6.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_6.text: Gortash may be low-born, but if he is half the man Ravengard has proven to be, Baldur's Gate can count itself fortunate twice over.
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_6.context: NodeContext: not being too insistent - as if making a point at a dinner party rather than at a debate

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_9.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_9.text: Doesn't matter if a Duke comes from decadence or dirt, as long as they have the city's interests at heart.
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_9.context: NodeContext: not being too insistent - as if making a point at a dinner party rather than at a debate

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_4.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_4.text: I hope these formalities don't last long.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_2.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_2.text: The refreshments are fine, but I won't feel safe until I'm back in the Upper City. Behind solid walls.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_5.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_5.text: We should request aid from Candlekeep while there's still time.
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_5.context: NodeContext: an off-hand suggestion rather than urgent

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_1.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_1.text: I hardly think Lord Gortash needs the assistance of ink-stained librarians. Everything is under control.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_10.speaker: Lady Beatrice Provoss
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_10.text: I've studied every book in my library and can find no mention of the Absolute anywhere.
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_10.context: NodeContext: an off-hand suggestion rather than urgent

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_7.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_7.text: Hardly surprising. Your library is almost entirely made up of tawdry chivalric romances.

AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_8.speaker: Lady Freida Oberon
AD_PatriarsDiscussGortashAndAbsolute_8.text: Still, even among the educated this Absolute is quite the mystery.

Ravengard_Dead_30.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_Dead_30.text: *The corpse does not stir. It will answer no more questions.*

Ravengard_Dead_34.speaker: Wyll
Ravengard_Dead_34.text: Father, I'm... sorry. But this fight's not over. Baldur's Gate won't fall, not while I still draw breath.

Ravengard_Dead_16.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_16.text: Father. Can you ever forgive me?

Ravengard_Dead_33.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_Dead_33.text: *The Grand Duke's corpse is silent. Perhaps it can't offer forgiveness. Perhaps it won't.*

Ravengard_Dead_35.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_35.text: How did the Absolute's cult capture you?

Ravengard_Dead_28.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_Dead_28.text: Attack on Waukeen's Rest... dragged to Moonrise...

Ravengard_Dead_0.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_0.text: Is there any way to defeat the Absolute?

Ravengard_Dead_27.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_Dead_27.text: Awaken the wyrm... drive the Absolute from the city...

Ravengard_Dead_24.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_24.text: Why were you at Waukeen's Rest?

Ravengard_Dead_36.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_Dead_36.text: Return to Baldur's Gate... awaken the wyrm... drive the Absolute from the city...

Ravengard_Dead_17.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_17.text: Awaken the wyrm? What wyrm do you mean?

Ravengard_Dead_26.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_26.text: How do I find the wyrm beneath the city?

Ravengard_Dead_8.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_8.text: How do I find the wyrm beneath the city?

Ravengard_Dead_29.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_Dead_29.text: Hidden entrance... Wyrm's Rock Prison... spark the torches...

Ravengard_Dead_1.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_1.text: Where can I find Counsellor Florrick?

Ravengard_Dead_6.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_6.text: Where can I find the elder brain?

Ravengard_Dead_3.speaker: Duke Ulder Ravengard
Ravengard_Dead_3.text: The Morphic Pool... beneath Baldur's Gate...

Ravengard_Dead_14.speaker: Player
Ravengard_Dead_14.text: How do I get to the Morphic Pool?

Ravengard_Dead_4.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_Dead_4.text: *The corpse remains silent. It does not know.*

Ravengard_Dead_37.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_Dead_37.text: *The spell's power wanes. You can ask no more questions.*

Ravengard_Dead_40.speaker: Wyll
Ravengard_Dead_40.text: Goodbye, father. May your soul be at rest.

Ravengard_Dead_39.speaker: Narrator
Ravengard_Dead_39.text: *The corpse seems willing to speak - but not to its killer.*

AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_005_0.speaker: GROUP_GLO_ManifestationOfTyranny
AD_ManifestationOfTyranny_005_0.context: NodeContext: Speaking one word of this final phrase: LORD OF DARKNESS, CLAIM YOUR OFFERING!

AD_AttackInOffice_0.speaker: Lord Enver Gortash
AD_AttackInOffice_0.text: Damned fool. I am Bane's Chosen. I am your death.

Patriar_006_0.speaker: Lord Sarken Eomane
Patriar_006_0.text: Under Gortash, we're safe. More to the point, my fortunes are safe.

Patriar_006_1.speaker: Lord Sarken Eomane
Patriar_006_1.text: Whatever you want, it can wait.

Patriar_006_2.speaker: Lord Sarken Eomane
Patriar_006_2.text: No cult army will touch me or my coin. Gortash will see to that.
